messages.content: Servus is a German word that means "servant" or "slave." It is typically used in historical or fictional contexts to refer to someone who is bound to serve another person, often through legal or social obligations. In some cases, the term servus may also refer to a person who is subservient or submissive to another.
any idea who bruno kreisky was?

Bruno Kreisky was an Austrian politician who served as the Chancellor of Austria from 1970 to 1983. He was a member of the Socialist Party of Austria and is regarded as one of the most significant figures in post-World War II Austrian politics.

Kreisky was born in Vienna in 1912 and studied law at the University of Vienna. He became involved in politics in the 1930s, joining the Socialist Party of Austria and working as a trade union organizer. After the end of World War II, he played a key role in the reconstruction of Austria and in the country's transition to a democratic, socialist state.

As Chancellor, Kreisky implemented a number of social and economic reforms, including the establishment of a welfare state and the nationalization of key industries. He also played a significant role in Austrian foreign policy, particularly in relations with the Soviet Union and other Eastern European countries.

Kreisky retired from politics in 1983 and died in 1990. He is remembered as a key figure in the development of modern Austria and as a champion of social justice and human rights.

Jörg Haider was an Austrian politician who was born in 1959. He was a member of the Austrian People's Party (ÖVP) and served as the Governor of Carinthia, a province in Austria, from 1999 until his death in 2016.

Jörg Haider was known for his controversial views on politics and society, and he was widely criticized for his remarks on immigration, minority rights, and other issues. He was also known for his confrontational style and his willingness to challenge the established political order in Austria.

Jörg Haider died in a car accident in 2016. His death was widely mourned in Austria, and he was remembered as a controversial and divisive figure who had left a lasting impact on Austrian politics and society.
